TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary:
[Supported in the .NET Framework 4.5.1 and later versions]
Indicates whether the next blocking garbage collection compacts the large object heap (LOH).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of the <xref:System.Runtime.GCSettings.LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is a member of the GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode enumeration that indicates whether the next full blocking garbage collection also compacts the large object heap (LOH). By default, the LOH is not compacted. A value of F:System.Runtime.GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode.CompactOnce?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True indicates that the blocking garbage collection will compact the LOH. After the garbage collection, the value of the P:System.Runtime.GCSettings.LargeObjectHeapCompactionMode?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True property reverts to F:System.Runtime.GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode.Default?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode CompactOnce = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The large object heap (LOH) will be compacted during the next blocking generation 2 garbage collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.GCLargeObjectHeapCompactionMode Default = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The large object heap (LOH) is not compacted.
